text:
Log Entry Shows:
[error] event_loop: unexpected state 1

Possible Causes:
- Error in the apr_pollset_remove function.
- Pool Lifetime Problems

The Event MPM seems to operate fine on Linux and FreeBSD.
creator: chip@force-elite.com

text:
To add some details:

The event thread gets into an infinite loop in apr_pollset_remove() because the
query_ring gets corrupted.

Via truss, the system calls look correct: my hunch is a pool lifetime issue of
some sort.
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org

text:
On FreeBSD, one of the processes will stop serving requests.  If you attach with
GDB, one of the workers gets stuck in pthread_mutex_unlock.  The event thread is
in kevent(), waiting for more events.  It seems that this is most likely a pool
lifetime issue, and solaris just explodes more violently with it :)
creator: chip@force-elite.com
chip@force-elite.com
text:
This specific bug is fixed in APR Trunk.  Root cause was a corrupted ring in the
pollset.
